page.title: 17WHITEHAVEN FISH CURING CO.
page.content: Fish curing is a new harbour-based industry.Clive Smitham,the proprietor, realised there were no fish-curers in the area but there was a market.He learned a lot from books and visited factories in the N.East.He arranged finance through his bank and bought the old lifeboat station.This was converted into a unit containing hot and cold smoking rooms,a finning machine,a vacuum-packing machine and lots of freezers.Most of the fish are bought locally in "kits"(10 stone)but some come from Scotland and Ireland. The main products are yellow fillets, kippers,smoked salmon and trout,and smoked eels.Kippers and yellow fillet are salted and dyed in a secret mixture before smoking, using woodchips.The fish are sold to local supermarkets & factory canteens.This small factory employs six people.
